pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Performance-oriented Congestion Control is a TCP Congestion control kernel module.
It uses an AI principles, for example to converge towards the best sending rates.
PCC Vivace has a slow start similar to cubic. Low consistent RTT. Throughput is very steady with fewest dips.
Both variants have low bufferbloat.
PCC Vivace has lower latency than PCC Allegro.
It can shave off hours of time sending data compared to cubic.

use.flag: Uses loss based sigmoid utility function without latency consideration [which may contribute to bufferbloat] + heuristic rate control. Created circa 2015. TCP version.
Uses a latency incorporating concave utility function + gradient ascent as rate control. Created circa 2018. TCP version. Safer version.
